medical_history.chief_complaint: Altered mental status and right flank pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient presented to the ER with altered mental status and concern for right flank pain. Symptoms are associated with fever to 102.6Â°F. Notably, the patient has substantial spinal stenosis and mild dementia.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS), Gastroesophageal Reflux Disease (GERD), high cholesterol, high blood pressure, leg blindness, hard of hearing, spinal stenosis with severe pain and limited mobility. Past surgical history includes cornea surgery, normal colonoscopy years ago, and hiatal hernia surgery for paraesophageal hernia.
